Reviews.Title: IP Camera
Reviews.Author: Príamo Gurule
Reviews.Content: I recently bought 2 cameras and I am very happy with them. Setup was pretty simple and it works well with my email account, it's a decent camera with a decent web interface that does what it's supposed to do and works reliably, supports modern features and multiple users can be configured with different access levels.The pen and tilt moves almost silently, and are quick and precise. The LEDs on the rear panels can be disabled to be less conspicuous, in a nice touch.I really love these cameras so far. They are good budget priced cameras and other cameras with an image that's no better and software that's much worse are priced much higher. It's a great balance of modern features and decent quality.

Reviews.Title: It works great and easy for setup
Reviews.Author: gosh p.
Reviews.Content: This IP camera works just as hoped it would. It took just a few minutes to get it running and connected to my wireless network. Once that was done, controlling the camera from my laptop, phone, and tablet was very easy. I can move the camera to different locations in my house, and within seconds of plugging it in, it is back on my wireless network and visible from my computer and other devices.I have used this mostly for monitoring my 2-year-old daughter, who just transitioned from a crib to a toddler bed. We initially wanted to keep an eye on her due to her newly discovered ability to get out of bed. That is no longer a problem, but we still keep the camera in her room for piece of mind.

Reviews.Title: awesome for the money
Reviews.Author: Freedom
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera for an experiment, for the money and features it had to offer it seemed like a no brainer, after comparing it to similarcameras in its price range and reading several reviews it has proven to be a wise choice, the camera is very easy to set up, and provides a veryclear picture, the user interface leaves a little to be desired, and the audio will not work for some reason, but audio is illegal to use in securitysurveilance in many states anyhow, dollar for dollar , I would recomend this camera , it moves very smooth and almost silently, would be nice if theyimprove the interface so that you can choose limits on auto scan movement, but I have yet to find a low end IP camera that does,  and zoom again wouldbe a valued upgrade to it's performance, but is only available in more expensive cameras as well,  try one, you should be pleased with it's performanceand appearance,

Reviews.Title: The camera has a very wide field of view. Good night resolution. It takes some work to properly setup
Reviews.Author: Adolfo D'Erizans
Reviews.Content: Excellent package. A bit tricky to setup, takes some skills with networks to properly setup. Great night resolution, very wide field of view. Takes

Reviews.Title: Good Wireless Camera - Recommended
Reviews.Author: C. Hill "CFH"
Reviews.Content: This Wireless Security Camera works very well once it is in place and setup on the wireless network. We have a small business and have both wired and wireless cameras in our system. Here are my observations:Pros -+ Quality; physically quality is excellent, I dropped this from 5' and it continued to operate just fine+ Image; on the best setting, it is very crisp and clear+ Features; able to send grabs on alarm to email or FTP servers, set time of day alerts+ Range; covers most of building+ Night Vision; quite clear even is complete darkness+ Audio Support; a very nice featureCons -- Clunky Interface; a little hard to navigate but once configured it is just fineOverall, this is a decent choice for an controllable wireless security camera.Recommended!CFHNote; sample unit provided for review

Reviews.Title: Clear images in a wireless format making set up and installation far more simple
Reviews.Author: Chandler
Reviews.Content: A step up...This one allows you to view the camera's scenes from your computer browser, smart phone.Full instructions that are easy to follow: You need a router, and any PC using Windows or a Mac.The benefits for me for this one is I had one but it had to be hardwired so it limited where I could put it and, especially at home, the last thing I need are more wires all over.  So this was easily mounted, no experience needed, and offered fast set up.This tilts up and down and the image is crystal.  I set it up to use on my iPad from a front window that's actually above my cabinets.  I can view who drives up, it works in real time and offers motion detection.My concern was how it would 'read" at night or in low light but it has night vision capabilities and we got some great images.  I tried this both with Safari and with Firefox on my desktop, phone, iPad...all worked well for me.I have not tried this in the office as I got it for personal use; It would work equally as well above a register or to keep an eye on things as it is compact and the images are as clear as a more expensive model I got years ago.Camera provided by Polaroid; the review is my honest and unbiased opinion

Reviews.Title: A tremendous advantage to the safety of your home or office
Reviews.Author: Grady Harp
Reviews.Content: The many features of this surveillance camera made by Polaroid make the price of the object seem impossibly low! This is an easy to install and very easy to access if you have Wi-Fi available and acts not only as a protective device for your place of installation but the messages it transmits can be picked up and monitored from a distance with the aid of a computer, laptop, iPad, iPhone or other android devices.The design of the camera device is compact and goes unnoticed as it scans 270 degrees with real-time audio and video streaming recording and still image capture. When daylight turns dark it automatically switches modes. The connectivity between the camera and your PC or mobile unit is secure. The motion detection is adjustable in order to send a signal to whatever device you have it programmed – meaning that while away form your home or office, you will be alerted to suspicious activity. You can adjust the sensitivity settings to be compatible to your workplace.For security at home or while way, this smart and well-designed device is top of the line. It can be connected to your Home Network and the Internet by Wi-Fi or network cable and works with Internet Explorer, Firefox, Safari, Google Chrome and all other popular browsers and mobile devices. Grady Harp, November 13

Reviews.Title: very low audio
Reviews.Author: Kamal
Reviews.Content: Camera is ok. Speaker volume is very very low. There is no app for this camera in android or iOS. No volume in MAC.

Reviews.Title: Pretty Nice but only for technically skilled
Reviews.Author: theMezz
Reviews.Content: If you are not technically skilled then do not buy this.Setup is only easy if you understand basic networking .. anyone else - - just skip this.

Reviews.Title: difficult to instal
Reviews.Author: Y. Wang "sw"
Reviews.Content: pros: picture quality better than expected (640x480). very quiet operation. looks good, seems well builtcons: everything else.If you don't at least have moderate command of electronics, you should stay away.  if you don't know what 'port forwarding' means for your router, you should stay away.the instruction manual was the worst ever, i'm fairly tech savy and it still took a while to install it.  the user name provided in the manual is wrong, it's admin, not Admin.  if i didn't figure this out by accident, i would not have been able to install it. I wasted 30 min on this alone. I never was able to get he sound to work...the user interface is horrible! especially if you try to use it on a smart phone, it's darn near impossible to operate it on the screen of a smart phone. you have to use your phone's browser to access it, it's not easy to do on my iphone 5SI think there's a very limited market for a product like this.

Reviews.Title: Baby monitor
Reviews.Author: Christopher Georges
Reviews.Content: I'm using this ip camera as a simple baby monitor for now and it works as expected.  Wireless instructions are pretty straight forward but it requires some router settings to be adjusted as well.

Reviews.Title: lot of time for installation
Reviews.Author: L. Cartwright
Reviews.Content: It is written that the camera is easy to install?  But it is anything but.  I have already been more than a week trying to get everything to work and I still cannot get it to email pictures?  Polaroid keeps bankers hours and their technicians were of little help.  I even had an ATT tech. come over and he was not able to get it to send email either?  So the next step for me is to try ehelp.com and if that doesn't work I may have to take it back.  Two breakins w/in the last year.  I was hoping this camera would work.  If you have the money you would probably be better off getting a different camera.

Reviews.Title: Good camera, bad software
Reviews.Author: Rayalpino
Reviews.Content: It will not let me install the active x used for using two-way audio and recording on IE,have tried it on 6 different computer with the same result, harmful to your computer to install and no way around it.

Reviews.Title: Okay - if you keep trying
Reviews.Author: Mark S. Woods
Reviews.Content: The camera may be OK, I'm not sure as I never got it working. The software is terrible. The web server on the camera repeatedly prompts for a userid for any operation, but will not accept the default userid provided in the instructions - unless it is typed in three times in a row. It looks like you can provide any old userid three times in a row and it will let you in to the site. Clicking on any page within the site prompts for userid once again. Looks like you can also hit "cancel" when prompted for a userid and still get in! Once in though, I couldn't get a video feed with either VLC on IE or Google Chrome or the Server Push Mode. That makes this thing pretty much useless to me. I'm sending it back.Update: I skipped using IE and went to a Chrome browser, using the userid "admin" rather than the specified "Admin". It worked! Setting it up for wireless access was a snap. Next hurdle is setting up DDNS.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy it.
Reviews.Author: Larry Crowder
Reviews.Content: I bought 2 IP200's and an IP300 and only 1 IP200 still works. These are junk don't waste your time

Reviews.Title: Stay away
Reviews.Author: Jakob "Swede"
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the worst set up instructions I have ever seen. I own a mac and work with macs professionally on a daily basis. The software comes on a CD which won't play on your mac...and there are no drivers to download from their website. I tried doing this manually but the booklet of instructions that's included doesn't address this on a mac...only on windows machines. Oh wait, it does say, if you own a mac, "it's pretty much plug and play". Btw, the manual reads like a 5 year old wrote them, spelling errors in every paragraph which really makes you feel confident about the product. This will be going back.*Update. Just got of the phone with their tech support. After 45 minutes of waiting, they realized that they haven't tested the product on the TWO most recent Mac OS systems...thus they have no idea if it actually works on Macs. They asked me to call back in two weeks to see if they would have an update. Impressive, isn't it?Update 2. Stay away from this seller. Extremely unpleasant to deal with...will charge you shipping and restocking fee regardless of reason for return.
